snippet: With no Democratic Party endorsement, black ministers’ support is thought to be particularly important for a special primary election in a district that has been remapped.
abstract: Candidates seeking to fill Congressional seat of Rep Jesse Jackson Jr are courting black clergy in district, particularly because Democratic Party leaderse have declined to endorse any candidate.
lead_paragraph: With no Democratic Party endorsement, black ministers’ support is thought to be particularly important for a special primary election in a district that has been remapped.

headline.seo: To Replace Jesse Jackson Jr., Candidates Court Clergy
headline.main: In Race to Fill Jackson’s House Seat, Candidates Court Chicago’s Black Clergy
headline.print_headline: In Race to Fill Jackson’s House Seat, Candidates Court Chicago’s Black Clergy
